snippet: Timothy Ray Jones Jr., who stands accused of killing his five children, has emerged as a tragically paradoxical figure.
abstract: Timothy Ray Jones Jr, South Carolina man who stands accused of killing his five children, has emerged as tragically paradoxical figure; court records and interviews show that in years before deaths of his children, he was leading fractured life fraught with feelings of betrayal, anxiety and mistrust, even while working as engineer for Intel.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS
byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Lexington, and Timothy Williams from New York. Kalyn Wolfe contributed reporting from Camden, Ala. Alain Delaquérière contributed research from New York.

lead_paragraph: Timothy Ray Jones Jr., who stands accused of killing his five children, has emerged as a tragically paradoxical figure.

headline.main: A Fractured Life, a Failed Marriage and 5 Small Bodies in Alabama
headline.print_headline: A Fractured Life, a Failed Marriage and 5 Small Bodies in Alabama
